intro: Daviesia corymbosa var. virgata, commonly known as the pink-flowered Daviesia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, wiry growth habit and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and woodland areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The species is also valued for its role in supporting local wildlife, particularly insects and birds.
